lessons.japanese: どうやら明日は雨のようだ。
lessons.indonesian: I'm afraid it will rain tomorrow.

lessons.japanese: どうやら明日は雨になりそうだ。
lessons.indonesian: Evidently, it's going to rain tomorrow.

lessons.japanese: どうやら風邪を引いたらしい。
lessons.indonesian: I seem to have caught a cold.

lessons.japanese: どうやら彼は長い間病気をしていたようです。
lessons.indonesian: He seems to have been ill for a long time.

lessons.japanese: どうやら電車の中に傘を置き忘れてきたらしい。
lessons.indonesian: I seem to have left my umbrella behind in the train.

lessons.japanese: どうやら晴れるようですね。
lessons.indonesian: It looks like it's going to be sunny.

lessons.japanese: どうやら食べ過ぎたみたいだ。
lessons.indonesian: I'm afraid I've eaten too much.

lessons.japanese: どうやら誤解があるようだ。
lessons.indonesian: There appears to be a misunderstanding.

lessons.japanese: どうやら君の言うことが正しいようだ。
lessons.indonesian: It looks as if you're right.

lessons.japanese: どうやらひどい風邪にかかったようだ。
lessons.indonesian: I seem to have caught a bad cold.

lessons.japanese: どうやら彼は昨日その会に間に合わなかったようだ。
lessons.indonesian: It seems that he was late for the meeting yesterday.

lessons.japanese: どうやらおっしゃるとおりだと思います。
どうやら、そのみすぼらしいアパートは空き家のようだ。
lessons.indonesian: Apparently that shabby flat is vacant.

lessons.japanese: あらごめんなさい。どうやら間違え電話をしてしまったようだね。
lessons.indonesian: Oh, I'm sorry. I guess I have the wrong number.

lessons.japanese: 私には後宮の支配者になる資質は、どうやらないようだ。
lessons.indonesian: It appears that I don't have it in me to have a harem in my charge.
